p: Note that while we use two different NGS technologies differing in their manufacturers’ reported error rates (Illumina: 0.001 vs. Ion Torrent: 0.01), Ion Torrent substitution error rates (excluding indels) are an order of magnitude lower (Bragg, Stone, Butler, Hugenholtz, & Tyson, 2013; Huang, Hung, & Wang, 2019) and thus similar to that of Illumina technology. Thus, a minority‐variant filter of <0.01 is appropriate and in agreement with cutoffs suggested by previous reports studying viral quasi‐species (Van den Hoecke, Verhelst, Vuylsteke, & Saelens, 2015).
